subject: Gardening
title: Therapeutic Garden Design
description: A quick win: understand Therapeutic Garden Design.

hook.text: Designed therapeutic gardens are prescribed by doctors for dementia patients. They reduce agitation by up to 30%.

buildup.text: Therapeutic gardens use specific design elements: looping paths (no dead ends), sensory plants, water sounds.

discovery.text: For dementia patients, circular paths prevent the anxiety of reaching a dead end. Familiar plants trigger memory recall.

twist.text: These principles apply to all garden users. Everyone benefits from sensory richness, safe paths.

climax.text: Therapeutic garden design isn't specialized medicine. It's universal designâ€”making gardens better for every human being.

punchline.text: Design for dementia patients and you design for everyone.

quiz.question: Why do therapeutic gardens for dementia use looping paths instead of straight ones?
options: Straight paths are too boring for patients who walk frequently
Circular paths prevent the anxiety of reaching dead ends
Looping paths provide more exercise per square foot of garden
